name: Cabanas Copal

reviews.text: I absolutely loved this place. Very simple and beautiful, the most relaxing spot I have ever stayed at. I stayed in cabin 5, as close to the ocean as you an get. Just a little hut with a bed and a sand floor. The bathrooms are shared, but clean and close by. You can hear the ocean and feel the breeze in the cabana, which makes for a relaxing atmosphere. The beach is among the most beautiful i have ever seen, and is clothing optional. The whole place just has a very nice relaxed, natural feel to it. I am going back to the Yucatan in January and have already booked some time at Copal again.
reviews.title: Love it! going back in January

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time to Mexico and we were staying for two weeks, July 17th threw the 30th. We had researched both Cancun and Tulum before making our choice for peace and quite away from in my opinion an Americanized party city. Having chosen Tulum we researched hotels in the area and chose Cabañas Copal.
reviews.title: Wonderful time at Copal

likes.disliked: — The brackish water. Rocks in the ocean.

reviews.text: Once at Cabañas Copal, check in was a breeze as I had done everything ahead of time for check in on-line and we were taken to Sea View King cabana #14 and yes they are small but cozy. The manager Diego was wonderful as he was always ready to help with any and all questions we had.
reviews.title: Great in every way except mosquitoes

likes.liked: — The food, cabana, employees, beach access, wildlife, sand, setting, room service.
likes.disliked: — Mosquitoes, lack of repairs, dirty beach, spa services,

reviews.title: Loved our wedding at Copal!!!!!!!
reviews.text: We never had any problems but with the mosquitoes as you can get mosquito coils at the Super San Francisco in Tulum town and that did the trick to keeping them at bay at night.

The food at the restaurant is OK and we ate in the restaurant many times while there. But you can find cheaper fare if you wish by walking down the road to Tres Luna's in the hotel zone where you can eat a full breakfast for $4.00 and they have a wonderful dinner menu too. Yummy! We mainly ate there and would visit with the owner Carlos and his wife Amanda during our meals.
reviews.title: It is close to eco hell

likes.liked: — really, there was nothing. I wanted to get away as soon as I arrived.

reviews.title: Cabanas Copal great place to go!
reviews.text: Just wanted to let everyone know, just came back from 7 days at Cabanas Copal and we loved it. The weather was great the employees were very nice especially Erica at the Tun Tun Bar, she was great. We would recommend everyone to experience this place at least once. We will be going back next year.
Last july, we spent a week in Cabanas Copal, our little paradise at the Caribean sea. It was a truly wonderful experience.
reviews.title: A little paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cabanas copal are beautifully located in the jungle near a beautiful and quiet beach. We had a seaview quad, with an amazing view and more importantly, enough breese to keep the cabana cool during the hot summer nights. The cabanas are well maintained. We had comfortable beds and our own little seaview bathroom. The salty water in the shower really did not bother us at all. We brought our three young daughters (7, 8 and 9 years old) and they loved the open space, the hammock in front of our cabana and the sea. If you truly insist on luxury, don't come here. However, if you want to enjoy the Caribean sea in all its natural beauty in a wonderful and relaxed setting, you'll have to come and discover this little paradise.
reviews.title: Never Again! Run!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant has a very relaxed atmosphere and the food is very nice, although a bit expensive.There are also a couple of nice restaurants on walking distance.
reviews.title: Beautiful beach adventure!

likes.liked: — beautiful beach and jungle, nice people
likes.disliked: — the heat and humidity, the mosquitos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an amazing time in Cabanas Copal, and we'll definitely would like to go back some day.
reviews.title: Hot and Heavenly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're a couple in early 30's, stayed in January for a few days and found a rustic cabanas on the beach with a great view in the morning when the sun rises and you can actually see it in the window and feel it in your body as the sun warms you up. I would think that if you don't have the sea view you wouldn't enjoy the place as much. Lack of facilities is a big plus... all the candles adds to the excitement: assuming you still have some left... Otherwise search for a luxury/all inclusive?...
reviews.title: Rough, Romantic and worth it

reviews.text: I just recently returned from Copal and cannot say enough about the place! Stunning! The cabanas are tucked back in coconut groves and sandy paths that feel like you're on an island of your own. While it was May and quite hot, night time was very cool, even being in a gardenview cabana (#33, highly recommend it). The decor inside was simple and beautiful, w/a tiled shower and lovely sink/mirror.
reviews.title: Paradise: found.

likes.liked: — The beach, seclusion, laid back vibe.
likes.disliked: — Sand! Shotty service here and there, could have a little better food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had plently of hot water, and while the staff was a little hit or miss, overall everyone was very friendly and helpful. The price was perfect, $80 a night w/a summer special of 7 nights for the price of 5. The bar and restaurant both had good food, and was in walking distance to other great restaurants like Zama's and TreceLunas, as well as great shops.
reviews.title: Relaxing and Natural

likes.disliked: — Could use more shady areas on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was amazing and you could walk for awhile w/o any rocks, even saw a sea turtle while there. There was quite a few iguanas and lizards, but they kept to themselves. While I usually like to go to a different spot every year for vacation, I think I'm going to have to return to Tulum next year, and I couldn't imagine staying anywhere other than Copal!
reviews.title: A great get away that is exactly as advertised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cabans Copal, May 17th to 23rd
reviews.title: tripadvisor let me down this time....

likes.disliked: — nothing like website and photos made it out to be, very very disappointing.

reviews.text: The experience you live at Cabanas Copal is amazing!!! Waking up in paradise inside a beautiful cabana surrounded by the jungle and looking at the turquoise color of the sea is priceless!!! Thanks to all the people that work in Copal for making our stay unforgettable!!!
reviews.title: Amazing Place.....a wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have found Cabanas Copal by Accident, we were booked in another hotel in the area but it was so bad that we had to check out and look for better accommodtions, we drove into a small restaurant named Zahra (great food en services by the way) and our waiter waiter suggested to try Copal, he even took us himself to the front desk and were greeted by a lovely senorita Monse who showed us around and fell inmediately in love with the cabanas right in front of the most amazing blue ocean and great beach, no electricity, no phones, no tv just jungle, white sand and lots of stars, our bed had a mosquito net that makes it look like a fairy tale, nicely done ample and very clean room.
reviews.title: Found paradise by accident

reviews.text: I was impressed that such little complex has such wonderful staff from the maid to the managers, they were always smiling and eager to help specially Erica at the beach bar, Juan at the main restaurant and of course Monse our star receptionist, the food was fantastic and the SPA was just out of this world thanks to Daniel who by the way helped me with a chronical neck pain that disapeared after his tratments.
reviews.title: I would give this place a B-

likes.disliked: — The room - the tempurature, and mosquito nets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Muchos gracias amigos!
reviews.title: Jungle and Beach Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from staying at Copal.
reviews.title: ugly

description: Get ready for an exotic vacation at Cabañas Copal Hotel, away from telephones and electricity. Come to Cabañas Copal to relax at our seaside Caribbean cabañas and holistic spa. Our central location puts our eco-hotel just 3 km. from the Mayan ruins of Tulum. Cabañas Copal Hotel in Tulum gets you off the beaten path for an alternative vacation experience in our rustic eco-hotel. Our cabanas are nestled in the tropical jungle by the sea.
